speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Chapter Eleven: Batch Studio Sequencing. You are already inside the Batch Studio — this tutorial is running in it right now. It is your non-linear editor for audio production, designed for building complex scenes with multiple lines, voices, and engines.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Each row in the Batch Studio is a Script Block. Every block is an independent generation unit with its own engine, voice, style, text, and settings. You can mix and match freely — one block can be a Custom Voice line from Ryan, the next can be a Voice Design character, and the next can be a voice clone.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The Auto-Switch checkbox is the key to seamless automation. When enabled, the studio automatically loads the correct A I model for each block when you run the scene. Without it, you would need to manually switch engines between blocks.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Each block also has a Seed field. Enter a number to pin that block to a reproducible take. Leave it empty and the studio picks a random seed, then writes it back into the field so you can re-run the exact same take later. The Dice button next to the seed rolls a random number you can save.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Each block has two special generation buttons. The lightning bolt Gen button generates only that single block immediately, without touching anything else in the scene. Use this for quick retakes without rerunning the entire script.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The Multi-Take button — that is the dice icon with a three — generates three variations of that block silently in the background and then opens a picker dialog. You preview each variation and select the best one. The winning seed is automatically saved into the block.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: For large projects, click a block's header to collapse it. This keeps your workspace clean. You can also save your entire scene to a file and reload it in a future session. The File menu in the Batch Studio toolbar handles this.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: For best efficiency, group blocks by engine. Place all Custom blocks together, then all Clone blocks together. This minimises model-switching time. The Auto-Switch feature handles the transitions, but fewer switches means a faster overall run.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Please load Chapter Twelve: Batch Studio Review, and we will cover the approval workflow and how to export your finished audio.
